summary:
West Africa is a region at the western tip of the African continent. It includes 16 countries and has a large population of over 400 million people. This area has a rich history, with ancient empires like Mali and Gao controlling trade routes. The region was heavily impacted by the Atlantic slave trade. Later, European countries colonized it, focusing on resource extraction. Today, West African nations are important in the global economy.

The region's ecology is diverse, from tropical forests to drylands, but is threatened by issues like deforestation and climate change.
title: West Africa
